transportAdvice: Dakar has a network of local minibuses and shared taxis that cover most of the city, though they can be crowded and confusing for first-time visitors; metered taxis and ride-hailing options are widely available and recommended for tourists. Walking is practical in some neighborhoods like the Plateau but less so across the sprawling peninsula, and a new regional express rail line connects the city center to the airport and suburbs.

weather.description: Cool and dry with pleasant breezes, one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Dry and sunny with mild temperatures, excellent conditions for sightseeing and beach visits.
Warm and dry, still very pleasant with little chance of rain.
Temperatures begin to rise and humidity increases slightly, but conditions remain largely dry.
Getting warmer with occasional harmattan dust haze; rain remains rare.
The rainy season begins to approach, with rising humidity and occasional showers.
Peak rainy season with frequent heavy downpours, though rain often comes in intense bursts rather than all day.
The wettest month of the year with high humidity and regular rainfall; flooding can occur in low-lying areas.
Still within the rainy season with significant humidity, though rainfall begins to taper toward month's end.
Rains diminish but humidity remains high; temperatures are at their annual peak.
The dry season returns with cooling temperatures and much more comfortable conditions.
Cool, dry, and sunny â€” a popular time to visit with ideal weather for outdoor activities.
